thread.title: Official: State revenue seen falling short of goals
thread.title_full: Official: State revenue seen falling short of goals

title: Official: State revenue seen falling short of goals
text: Posted Oct. 16, 2015 at 6:25 PM Posted Oct. 16, 2015 at 6:25 PM » Social News BOSTON (AP) — Gov. Charlie Baker's administration is revising downward its state revenue projection for the current fiscal year. In a letter to the governor and the Legislature's Ways and Means committee, Secretary of Administration and Finance Kristen LePore said total budgeted revenue is now seen as falling $145 million short of the estimate on which the state's $38 billion budget is based. LePore says the state remains on track to meet its goal of $26.1 billion in tax collections for the fiscal year that started July 1. The problem is with non-tax revenues — including various state fees — that are coming in at a lower-than-expected clip. Baker has made no move to cut spending at this time. A shortfall in last year's budget required a $765 million patch by the administration and Legislature. southcoasttoday.com
